product_description.Powerful 5G: The realme Narzo Pro 5G comes with 5G technology that reduces network latency while offering high download speed. This smartphone also offers 5G+5G Dual SIM Dual Standby, smart 5G power saving, and lowers power consumption to offer an exciting mobile computing experience.
product_description.Dimensity 700 5G Processor: The Dimensity 700 5G Processor is built on a 7nm process, and it offers impressive gaming performance. It increases the speed of both the CPU and GPU for a fast and smooth experience.
product_description.90 Hz Ultra Smooth Display: The display with a 180 Hz touch-sampling rate offers a fast response to touch. So, it is ideal for easy multitasking and intense gaming.
product_description.5000 mAh Massive Battery: The 5000 mAh Battery, along with an 18 W Type-C Quick Charge feature, offers hours of non-stop entertainment. So, you don’t need to charge it for hours to stay connected or entertained.
product_description.Super Power Saving Mode: This mode ensures that you can enjoy up to 2.1 hours of calling, up to 1.4 hours of chatting, and/or up to 5.6 hours of playing music with just 5% charge.
product_description.Dynamic RAM Expansion: This smartphone features realme’s Dynamic RAM expansion (DRE) technology to convert ROM into RAM. Thus, it offers more RAM space to let you open multiple apps, and for smooth switching of background apps.
product_description.V-speed Design: This design is inspired by the textures of the racing track. Thus, its appearance also offers a feel of thrill and speed.
product_description.48 MP Nightscape Camera: This smartphone comes with a 48 MP Nightscape Camera with portrait and macro lens. As a result, you can click lovely photos.
product_description.Night Filters: This smartphone comes with five night filters to let you click photos with stunning hues and effects.
product_description.3-card Slot: You can use two Nano SIM cards as well as one MicroSD card sim at the same time. So, you can use two different phone numbers and expand the memory capacity up to 1 TB.
product_description.Side-fingerprint Sensor: The side-fingerprint sensor protects your data, and also lets you unlock this smartphone quickly.
product_description.realme UI 2.0: This realme UI 2.0 is based on the Android 11 OS, and it has an intuitive, user-friendly, and smooth interface.

This mobile is value for money, it will not disappoint you. The application's run smoothly without any lags, call quality is too good in this model and the battery backup is awesome. Few things like wide-angle lens, higher watt charger and OLED display are missing but with this pricing we cannot expect features of a premium phones. Processor is Dimensity 700U, it does the job perfectly. Realme has used a higher quality display and it does the job at its best, the auto brightness works excellently during the outdoor and indoor conditions. Anyone who is planning to buy a 5g ready smartphone (Depends upon the band release) like me for longer duration can go for this handset. I have always used stock android mobile phones, I was bit worried about the UI experience while purchasing Narzo 30 5g but I am fully satisfied with the UI experience since Realme has made it very close to the stock android. The build quality is also good. This is my first Realme mobile and I should say it worth the money I have invested. Thank you!

writing this review after 10 days of usage. First of all, its a good buy for a 5G phone with 7 band support. screen, camera, battery is all good and use to use. The quality of the built with expandable RAM, Android 11 and UI v2 is all good and no complaints. I was a snapdragon user till now and this is my first Mediatek processor, though this comes with Dimensity 700 I could still feel my earlier SD625 Octa Core was better. Doesn't lag but speed is not as per SD, clearly Mediatek is not a competition to Snapdragon.
Heats up a little while charging and charging takes approx. 2 hrs from 0-100%. It comes with Dragontrail glass, which is again not a comparison to Gorilla glass.
Overall, its a good phone at this segment especially for the 7 bands of 5G network support and 5k MAH battery. Go for it, if your budget is around 15k and looking for a future proof phone with 5G

I am pleasantly surprised by the Narzo 30 5G. Build & Quality
The size is just perfect in my medium sized hands and even though it has a polycarbonate body, it doesn't creak and the hand feel is very good mainly due to the curved edges. The back is almost like glass and the racing blue looks beautiful. The PU Case fits tight and I feel every user must use as it's edges being slightly raised the screen and the camera module stay protected.
Screen
Even though the screen is IPS it's much better than many other Amoled screens found on costlier phones because it's an excellent high quality screen. Also since it's FHD+ the resolution is excellent. The brightness is more than 400 nits and hence even in sunlight legibility is really very good. Being a 90 Hertz screen the scrolling is very smooth and there are no judders or stutter.
Speaker & Earpiece
The speaker is quite loud and most of the time you don't have to put it on full blast. But the quality is average.
The earpiece is loud and clear and there are no issues with it.
Cameras.
The main snapper is a 48 mp one and delivers very good results in Daylight, artificial light and the night shots are surprisingly good even on this budget phone. All in all the camera including the front one is good.
Battery
It's a 5,000 mah LiPo and lasts me almost 2 days of medium use. The charger is an 18 watt one which takes 2½ hours to charge the phone from zero. Wish Realme had provided at least a 30 watt charger in the box.
Overall Experience
The phone performs very well and the Realme UI is fluent and smooth. It runs on Android 11 and works well. The best thing that it's Ad free and practically without bloatware. Also notifications can be turned off so users are spared the nuisance found on other budget phones which is a big relief.
WiFi & Call Quality
It's dual band so both 2.4 and 5 Gigs can be used and the call quality and signal strength is not an issue. WiFi calling is enabled but I haven't had to use it so far so can't comment.

All in all an excellent phone and real Value for Money.
